title: Create a directory — cnt_create_directory
text: Generic implementing create directory connector. Mostly relevant file storage connectors. connector_fs: Uses dir.create create directory path connector.

title: Create a directory — cnt_create_directory
code: cnt_create_directory(connector_object, name, ...)  # S3 method for class 'connector_fs' cnt_create_directory(connector_object, name, ...)

title: Create a directory — cnt_create_directory
text: name character name directory create ... Additional arguments passed method individual connector.

title: Create a directory — cnt_create_directory
text: invisible connector_object.

title: Create a directory — cnt_create_directory
code: # Create a directory in a file storage  cnt_fs <- connector_fs$new(tempdir())  cnt_fs |>   cnt_list_content(pattern = "new_folder") #> character(0)  cnt_fs |>   cnt_create_directory("new_folder") |>   cnt_list_content(pattern = "new_folder") #> [1] "new_folder"  cnt_fs |>   cnt_remove_directory("new_folder")

title: Download content from the connector — cnt_download
code: # Download file from a file storage cnt_fs <- connector_fs$new(tempdir())  cnt_fs |>   cnt_write("this is an example", "example.txt") #> Error in assert_ext(tools::file_ext(file), "write_ext"): Assertion on 'ext' failed: Must be element of set {'csv','parquet','rds','xpt'}, but is 'txt'.  list.files(pattern = "example.txt") #> character(0)  cnt_fs |>   cnt_download("example.txt")  list.files(pattern = "example.txt") #> character(0) readLines("example.txt") #> Warning: cannot open file 'example.txt': No such file or directory #> Error in file(con, "r"): cannot open the connection

code: # List content in a file storage cnt_fs <- connector_fs$new(tempdir())  cnt_fs |>   cnt_list_content() #> [1] "bslib-79d6c3840cf9ada48ee4fe53d867460d" #> [2] "downlit"                                #> [3] "file15e611e36de5"                       #> [4] "file15e67c9a0f90"                        # Only list CSV files using the pattern argument of list.files  cnt_fs |>   cnt_list_content(pattern = "\\.csv$") #> character(0)

title: Read content from the connector — cnt_read
text: R object content. rectangular data data.frame.

title: Read content from the connector — cnt_read
code: # Write and read a CSV file using the file storage connector cnt_fs <- connector_fs$new(tempdir())  cnt_fs |>   cnt_write(iris, "iris.csv")  cnt_fs |>   cnt_read("iris.csv") |>   head() #> Rows: 150 Columns: 5 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (1): Species #> dbl (4): Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #>          <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa  #> 2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa  #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa  #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa  #> 5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa  #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa

title: Create a tbl object — cnt_tbl.connector_dbi
code: connector <- connector_dbi$new(RSQLite::SQLite()) connector$cnt_write(iris, "iris") connector$cnt_tbl("iris") #> # Source:   table<`iris`> [?? x 5] #> # Database: sqlite 3.46.0 [] #>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa  #>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa  #>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa  #>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa  #> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa  #> # ℹ more rows

code: # Write different file types to a file storage cnt_fs <- connector_fs$new(tempdir())  cnt_fs |>   cnt_list_content(pattern = "iris") #> [1] "iris.csv"  # rds file cnt_fs |>   cnt_write(iris, "iris.rds")  # SAS transport file (xpt) cnt_fs |>   cnt_write(iris, "iris.xpt") #> Error: Failed to create column `Sepal.Length`: A provided name contains an illegal character.  cnt_fs |>   cnt_list_content(pattern = "iris") #> [1] "iris.csv" "iris.rds" "iris.xpt"

title: Connect to datasources specified in config file — connect
code: config <- system.file("config", "default_config.yml", package = "connector") con <- connect(config) #> Error in purrr::map(config$connections, create_connection): ℹ In index: 1. #> Caused by error in `try_connect()`: #> ! Error in connection to the backend. Please check the parameters. con #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'con' not found

title: General connector object — connector
code: # Create connector cnt <- connector$new()  cnt #> <connector>  # Standard error message if no method is implemented cnt |>   cnt_read("fake_data") |>   try() #> Error in cnt_read(cnt, "fake_data") :  #>   Method not implemented for class <connector/R6> #> ℹ See the customize (`vignette(connector::customize)`) vignette on how to #>   create custom connectors and methods  # Connection with extra class cnt_my_class <- connector$new(extra_class = "my_class")  cnt_my_class #> <my_class/connector>  # Custom method for the extra class cnt_read.my_class <- function(connector_object) "Hello!" registerS3method("cnt_read", "my_class", "cnt_read.my_class")  cnt_my_class #> <my_class/connector> #> Registered methods: #> • `cnt_read.my_class()`  cnt_read(cnt_my_class) #> [1] "Hello!"

title: Connector for DBI databases — connector_dbi

title: Connector for DBI databases — connector_dbi
code: # Create DBI connector  cnt <- connector_dbi$new(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")  cnt #> <connector_dbi> #> Inherits from: <connector> #> Registered methods: #> • `cnt_disconnect.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_list_content.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_read.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_remove.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_tbl.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_write.connector_dbi()` #> Specifications: #> • conn: <SQLiteConnection>  # Write to the database  cnt$cnt_write(iris, "iris")  # Read from the database  cnt$cnt_read("iris") |>   head(5) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa  # List available tables  cnt$cnt_list_content() #> [1] "iris"  # Use the connector to run a query  cnt$conn #> <SQLiteConnection> #>   Path: :memory: #>   Extensions: TRUE  cnt$conn |>   DBI::dbGetQuery("SELECT * FROM iris limit 5") #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa  # Use dplyr verbs and collect data  cnt$cnt_tbl("iris") |>   dplyr::filter(Sepal.Length > 7) |>   dplyr::collect() #> # A tibble: 12 × 5 #>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species   #>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>     #>  1          7.1         3            5.9         2.1 virginica #>  2          7.6         3            6.6         2.1 virginica #>  3          7.3         2.9          6.3         1.8 virginica #>  4          7.2         3.6          6.1         2.5 virginica #>  5          7.7         3.8          6.7         2.2 virginica #>  6          7.7         2.6          6.9         2.3 virginica #>  7          7.7         2.8          6.7         2   virginica #>  8          7.2         3.2          6           1.8 virginica #>  9          7.2         3            5.8         1.6 virginica #> 10          7.4         2.8          6.1         1.9 virginica #> 11          7.9         3.8          6.4         2   virginica #> 12          7.7         3            6.1         2.3 virginica  # Disconnect from the database  cnt$cnt_disconnect()

title: Connector for file storage — connector_fs
text: connector_fs class file storage connector accessing manipulating files file storage solution. default implementation includes methods files stored local network drives.

title: Connector for file storage — connector_fs
code: # Create file storage connector  cnt <- connector_fs$new(tempdir())  cnt #> <connector_fs> #> Inherits from: <connector> #> Registered methods: #> • `cnt_create_directory.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_download.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_list_content.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_read.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_remove.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_remove_directory.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_upload.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_write.connector_fs()` #> Specifications: #> • path: /tmp/RtmpXYE8WU  # List content  cnt$cnt_list_content() #> [1] "bslib-79d6c3840cf9ada48ee4fe53d867460d" #> [2] "downlit"                                #> [3] "example.txt"                            #> [4] "file15e611e36de5"                       #> [5] "file15e65f88ee7a"                       #> [6] "file15e67c9a0f90"                       #> [7] "iris.csv"                               #> [8] "iris.rds"                               #> [9] "iris.xpt"                                # Write to the connector  cnt$cnt_write(iris, "iris.rds")  # Check it is there  cnt$cnt_list_content() #> [1] "bslib-79d6c3840cf9ada48ee4fe53d867460d" #> [2] "downlit"                                #> [3] "example.txt"                            #> [4] "file15e611e36de5"                       #> [5] "file15e65f88ee7a"                       #> [6] "file15e67c9a0f90"                       #> [7] "iris.csv"                               #> [8] "iris.rds"                               #> [9] "iris.xpt"                                # Read the result back  cnt$cnt_read("iris.rds") |>   head(5) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa

title: Collection of connector objects — connectors
code: # Create connectors objects  con <- connectors(   sdtm = connector_fs$new(path = tempdir()),   adam = connector_dbi$new(drv = RSQLite::SQLite()) )  # Print for overview  con #> <connectors> #>   $sdtm <connector_fs> #>   $adam <connector_dbi>  # Print the individual connector for more information  con$sdtm #> <connector_fs> #> Inherits from: <connector> #> Registered methods: #> • `cnt_create_directory.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_download.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_list_content.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_read.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_remove.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_remove_directory.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_upload.connector_fs()` #> • `cnt_write.connector_fs()` #> Specifications: #> • path: /tmp/RtmpXYE8WU  con$adam #> <connector_dbi> #> Inherits from: <connector> #> Registered methods: #> • `cnt_disconnect.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_list_content.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_read.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_remove.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_tbl.connector_dbi()` #> • `cnt_write.connector_dbi()` #> Specifications: #> • conn: <SQLiteConnection>

title: connector Options — options
text: Internally used, package-specific options. options prioritize R options() values, fall back environment variables undefined. neither option environment variable set, default value used.

title: connector Options — options
text: Option values specific connector can accessed passing package name env.

title: connector Options — options
text: verbosity_level default: "verbose" option: connector.verbosity_level envvar: R_CONNECTOR_VERBOSITY_LEVEL (evaluated possible, raw string otherwise)

title: Internal reuse of options description — options_params
text: verbosity_level chatty log ? Possibilities quiet, verbose, debug. (Defaults "verbose", overwritable using option 'connector.verbosity_level' environment variable 'R_CONNECTOR_VERBOSITY_LEVEL')

title: Read files based on the extension — read_file
code: temp_csv <- tempfile("iris", fileext = ".csv") write.csv(iris, temp_csv, row.names = FALSE) read_file(temp_csv) #> Rows: 150 Columns: 5 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (1): Species #> dbl (4): Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 150 × 5 #>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa  #>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa  #>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa  #>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa  #>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa  #>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa  #> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa  #> # ℹ 140 more rows
